channel.title: Introduction on Jumpstart Academy: Building Blocks of the Web
channel.description: Recent content in Introduction on Jumpstart Academy: Building Blocks of the Web

item.title: What's a Web Page?
item.description: At the most basic level, a web page consists of a text document and a web browser. The text document, or your content, is written in a language called HTML (Hyper Text Markup Language). Your browser is able to read that file and render the HTML markup. The file The HTML inside the file <p>Hello.</p> The file opened in a web browser That’s it. That’s a web page. No Server Needed You’ll notice the example web page is running on its own.
